sentences.english: At that time, only a few officials or divination people.
sentences.chinese: 当时，只有少数官吏或卜人使用。

sentences.english: The emperor came himself in the morning with his officers.
sentences.chinese: 早晨皇帝亲自率领他的官吏们来了。

sentences.english: The word “placeman” is often used contemptuously.
sentences.chinese: “官吏”这个词在使用时常常带有轻蔑的含义。

sentences.english: The part of 3th is elaborated emphatically "Prestigious-Faborable " feudal official 's political intension.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分着重阐述了“威惠”型官吏的政治内涵。

sentences.english: He is only a petty official.
Enter duke, aegeon, gaoler, officers, and other attendants.
sentences.chinese: 公爵，伊济安，狱卒，官吏等，及其他侍从等上。

sentences.english: They take a big shot at those corrupted officials.
sentences.chinese: 他们把矛头直接对准了腐败的官吏。

sentences.english: Officials were also not up to the Princess House search.
sentences.chinese: 官吏们也不能到公主府上去搜查。

sentences.english: Zhang was a minor official in the county government.
sentences.chinese: 张生是县衙里的一个小官吏。

definition: imperial censor (formal title of a dynastic official)
county magistrate (during Tang to Qing times)
senior provincial official in imperial China
high-ranking officials in the court of a Chinese emperor
